isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics Model Years 1999-2000 - MECHANICAL DIAGNOSTICS - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - ICP Pressure Test

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if the high pressure lube oil system is providing sufficient hydraulic pressure to operate the injectors.

svcsubproc.title: Test Procedure

warning.para: Read all safety instructions in this manual before doing this procedure.

svcsubproc.para: Do this procedure at full load in conjunction with Fuel Pressure Test (Test 11) and, Boost Pressure Test (Test 13).

note.para: Turn all accessories and the ignition off, before connecting Electronic Service Tool (EST) tool to American Trucking Association (ATA) diagnostic connector.

step1.para: Connect the EST to the ATA data link connector.

Start Master Diagnostics and select the Road Performancesession. Drive the vehicle on the road until the engine reaches operating temperature. Find an open section of road and select a suitable gear. Depress the accelerator pedal (full depression) to the floor and accelerate to rated speed and 100% load.

note.para: Drive the vehicle uphill or fully loaded to reach the correct engine loading at rated engine speed.

step1.para: Read minimum and maximum voltages for ICP pressure and record on Mechanical Diagnostic form EGED-180-2.
Stop the vehicle, read voltages for low and high idle ICP pressures, and record on Mechanical Diagnostic form EGED-180-2.

svcsubproc.title: Alternate Method for Measuring ICP using (Breakout Tee)

step1.para: Remove engine harness connector from ICP sensor.
Connect ICP breakout tee to the removed engine harness connector and the ICP sensor.
Use a DMM and connect a long set of leads (+ Green, - Black) to breakout tee (ZTSE4347), as shown above.

Drive vehicle on road until the engine reaches operating temperature. Find an open section of road and select a suitable gear. Depress the accelerator pedal (full depression) to the floor and accelerate to rated speed and 100% load.

note.para: Drive the vehicle uphill or fully loaded to reach the correct engine loading at rated engine speed.

svcsubproc.title: Possible Causes
svcsubproc.para: Low voltage for injection pressure indicates insufficient oil pressure to operate the fuel injectors. Insufficient oil pressure can be caused by

item.para: or the ECM commanding the IPR valve to reduce injection control pressure due to:
Incorrect feedback signal from Accelerator Position Sensor (APS)
Incorrect feedback signal from ICP sensor (check part number)

svcsubproc.para: To check for insufficient oil pressure, do ICP Leakage Test (Test 13).

item.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software
